author: Imani Moise
title: Southwest Forecasts Weaker Bookings After Fatal Accident
text:
Southwest Airlines Co. said bookings have dropped since last weekâ€™s fatal accident on the largest domestic U.S. airline.
The carrier froze all advertising in the wake of the incident on a flight from New York to Dallas, a move executives said had cost the airline bookings into May and up to $100 million in lost revenue.
Southwest and rival... RELATED VIDEO Southwest Flight 1380: What Happened Onboard The Wall Street Journal used video shared on social media and other reporting to piece together how the engine on Southwest Airlines flight 1380 broke apart, ultimately killing a passenger and forcing an emergency landing.
